description: This table stores tracked recommendation information and Blood result dispense status for orders-related results. This table can also store Dermatology Skin Findings.

columns.name: FINDING_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the finding record corresponding to this result.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: REC_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The recommendation status category ID for a result finding.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Needs Follow-up


Closed


Resolved

columns.name: ADMINPX_ORD_DAT
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format from which the corresponding order's tracked result originated. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: ADMINPX_BLOODSTAT_C_NAME
columns.description:
The blood product status history category ID for the order, as sent via a results interface from a blood bank.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Requested


Selected


Issued


Transfusing


Transfused


Returned


Expired/Released

columns.name: LESION_REMOVE_CMT
columns.description: The comments entered by the user when a lesion was removed from a patient's record.

columns.name: LAST_DOC_DTTM
columns.description: The date and time when this finding was last documented on.

columns.name: LESION_REMOVE_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The removal reason category ID for the lesion.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Other


Removing incorrect data

columns.name: DX_ID
columns.description: This item stores the diagnosis associated with a finding.

columns.name: NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the note associated with this finding.

columns.name: REGION_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the anatomic region where a finding was placed.

columns.name: REGION_ID_RECORD_NAME
columns.description: Stores record name (.2)

columns.name: BACKGROUND_AVATAR_C_NAME
columns.description:
The avatar image category ID that was showing when the result finding was placed onto a location on the body.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Adult Male


Adult Female


Adult Neutral


Oropharynx


Adult Hands


Adult Feet


Male Genitalia


Female Genitalia


Adult Head


Child Neutral


Standard Colon


Standard Upper GI Tract


EUS


ERCP


Pulm


Left Hemicolectomy


Right Hemicolectomy


Sigmoid Colectomy


Colostomy


J-Pouch


Sigmoidoscopy


Billroth I


Billroth II


Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass 


Nissen Fundoplication


Sleeve Gastrectomy


Lower EUS 


Remote Client

columns.name: DERM_FINDING_COUNT
columns.description: The number of findings in this result finding record. Allows user to document like findings in the same anatomical region under one result finding record

columns.name: FINDING_LOC_SUFFIX
columns.description: This items stores a suffix string that was added by the user to make a finding location unique.

columns.name: FINDING_LOC_NAME
columns.description: This items stores an override name string that was added by the user to make a finding location unique.

columns.name: GROUP_NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the group note associated with this finding.

columns.name: PLAN_NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the plan note associated with this finding.

columns.name: REC_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores the reasons why a screening program recommendation was selected.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Inadequate bowel preparation


Inflammatory bowel disease


Personal history of colon polyps


Personal history of colon cancer


Family history of colon polyps


Family history of colon cancer


Age greater than 65


Gastric ulcer surveillance


Barrett's esophagus surveillance


Dysphagia


Reflux symptoms


Dyspepsia


Abnormal pathology


Incomplete procedure


Patient preference


Life expectancy is less than 10 years


Overall health


Prior screening history


Abnormal pathology


Incomplete procedure
